cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW today, then turning NW Sunday-Monday across central/western Cuba and into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the west coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida peninsula (Big Bend / Nature Coast area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at the time of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida at the time of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and the entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward through the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: 20–34% chance of sustained 34-kt (39+ mph) winds beginning late Tuesday; up to 7% chance of 50-kt (58+ mph) winds. Gusty squalls likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge possible (around 1–3 ft) along Tampa Bay depending on exact track, but values currently expected to remain below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher totals if outer rain-bands train across the area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in and near Tampa Bay beginning Tuesday; potential for brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
